definitions_glossary.proper_divisors: All positive divisors of n except n itself
definitions_glossary.aliquot_sum: Sum of proper divisors, denoted s(n) = σ(n) - n
definitions_glossary.divisor_function: σ(n) = sum of all positive divisors of n
definitions_glossary.sociable_numbers: Generalization where s(s(...s(n)...)) = n for cycles of length > 2
definitions_glossary.betrothed_numbers: Also called quasi-amicable; similar concept with slight variation

properties: Over 12 million amicable pairs known as of 2024
No odd amicable pairs have been found (conjectured that none exist)
Both numbers in a pair have the same parity (both even or both odd)
Many amicable pairs are generated by Thābit's rule, but not all

thabit_ibn_qurra_rule.statement: If p = 3×2^(n-1) - 1, q = 3×2^n - 1, and r = 9×2^(2n-1) - 1 are all prime, then 2^n × p × q and 2^n × r are amicable
thabit_ibn_qurra_rule.limitation: Not all amicable pairs follow this pattern

open_problems.partial_results: If they exist, both must be > 10^500

open_problems.problem: Are there infinitely many amicable pairs?

definition.@value: Two numbers where each equals the sum of proper divisors of the other

related.relationship: Perfect numbers are like amicable numbers with self (s(n) = n)
Sociable numbers extend amicable pairs to longer cycles

learning_objectives: Define amicable numbers and amicable pairs
Compute divisor sums to verify amicable relationships
Understand the relationship to perfect numbers
Recognize as an active area of research
common_errors: Including n in its own divisor sum
Thinking amicable numbers must be consecutive
Believing all pairs follow Thābit's rule
teaching_tips: Show divisor calculation step by step
Compare and contrast with perfect numbers
Use computational tools to explore pairs
pedagogical.historical_context: Amicable numbers were known to the Pythagoreans who associated them with friendship. The smallest pair (220, 284) appears in biblical commentary and medieval texts as symbols of perfect friendship. Despite being studied for over 2500 years, many fundamental questions remain unanswered.
